name: SSRA
description: The model of 1933, Quick Fire Weapon, Mark 2, Standard Service Rifle Automatic(shortened, for obvious reasons, to SSRA), was developed in 1933 to replace both the SSR and the QFW in Cannalan inventory. Typically chambered for the M1926 SRC round, it also came chambered in a half-inch shotgun shell almost identical to .410 bore shotgun shells.

name: SSRA magazine
description: The standard box magazine utilized by QFW and their replacements, the SSRA.

name: QFS magazine
description: What was a standard SSRA magazine has been lightly modified(alas, in a manner you cant replicate) to hold .410 bore rounds instead of the same number of SRC rounds, turning it into a Quick-Fire Shotgun magazine.
